---
title: "Burr"
---

## Type I

Burr-I distribution is [uniform](unifpareto.qmd) distribution.

## Type II

Burr-II distribution is [generalized logistic](logistic.qmd) distribution

## Type III

Burr III is called inverse Burr distribution or Dagum I type distribution

$$
Q(u)=\left(u^{-\frac{1}{\beta}}-1\right)^{-\frac{1}{\alpha}}
$$
Related to it is Dagum II (and Dagum III)

$$
Q(u)=\left[\left(\frac{u-\delta}{1-\delta}\right)^{-\frac{1}{\beta }}-1\right]^{-\frac{1}{\alpha }}
$$

In Dagum II $0\leq\delta\leq1$ and in Dagum III $\delta<0$.

## Type IV

Burr IV is bathtub-shaped distribution with QF

$$
Q(u)=\frac{\alpha}{1+\left(u^{-\frac{1}{\beta}}-1\right)^\alpha}
$$

## Type V

Burr V is arctan-transformed distribution

$$
Q(u)=\arctan\left[-\ln\left(\frac{u^{-\frac{1}{\beta}}-1}{\alpha}\right)\right]
$$

## Type VI

Burr VI is asinh transformed distribution

$$
Q(u)=\text{arcsinh}\left[-\frac{\ln\left(u^{-\frac{1}{\beta}}-1\right)}{\alpha}\right]
$$

## Type VII

Burr VII is arctanh transformed distribution

$$
Q(u)=\text{arctanh}\left[(2u)^{\frac{1}{\alpha}}-1\right]
$$

## Type VIII

Burr VIII is log-tan transformed distribution

$$
Q(u)=\ln\left[\tan\left(\frac{\pi }{2}u^{\frac{1}{\alpha}}\right)\right]
$$

## Type IX

Burr IX is a log-transformed distribution

$$
Q(u)=\ln\left[\left(1+\frac{u}{\alpha(1-u)}\right)^{\frac{1}{\beta}}\right]
$$

## Type X

Burr X is a square root of exponential

$$
Q(u)=\sqrt{-\ln(1-u^{\frac{1}{\alpha}})}
$$

## Type XI

Burr XI is not invertible

## Type XII

Burr XII is known as Pareto-IV distribution or the Singhâ€“Maddala distribution

$$
Q(u)=\left[(1-u)^{-\frac{1}{\alpha}}-1 \right]^{\frac{1}{\beta}}
$$

Burr XII is the inverse of Burr III.
